children.value: First steps using Harmonised Data access API

children.label: First steps using Harmonised Data access API

children.value: Discover data of DestinE Data Portfolio
Search data of DestinE Data Portfolio and visualize the results
Access Data of DestinE Data Portfolio and visualize the thumbnails
This notebook demonstrates how to use the HDA (Harmonized Data Access) API by sending a few HTTP requests to the API, using Python code.
Throughout this quickstart notebook, you will learn:
services and data collections through HDA.
: How to authenticate to search and access
The detailed API and definition of each endpoint and parameters is available in the HDA Swagger UI at:
We start off by importing the relevant modules for HTTP requests and json handling.

from typing import Union
import requests
import json
import urllib.parse
from IPython.display import JSON
from IPython.display import Image

import geopandas
import folium
import folium.plugins
from branca.element import Figure
import shapely.geometry
Define some constants for the API URLs

children.label: Define some constants for the API URLs

children.value: In this section, we define the relevant constants, holding the URL strings for the different endpoints.

# IDS
SERVICE_ID = "dedl-hook"
COLLECTION_ID = "EO.EUM.DAT.SENTINEL-3.SL_1_RBT___"
ITEM_ID = "S3B_SL_1_RBT____20240918T102643_20240918T102943_20240919T103839_0179_097_336_2160_PS2_O_NT_004"

# Core API
HDA_API_URL = "https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu"
SERVICES_URL = f"{HDA_API_URL}/services"
SERVICE_BY_ID_URL = f"{SERVICES_URL}/{SERVICE_ID}"

# STAC API
## Core
STAC_API_URL = f"{HDA_API_URL}/stac"
CONFORMANCE_URL = f"{STAC_API_URL}/conformance"

## Item Search
SEARCH_URL = f"{STAC_API_URL}/search"
DOWNLOAD_URL = f"{STAC_API_URL}/download"

## Collections
COLLECTIONS_URL = f"{STAC_API_URL}/collections"
COLLECTION_BY_ID_URL = f"{COLLECTIONS_URL}/{COLLECTION_ID}"

## Items
COLLECTION_ITEMS_URL = f"{COLLECTIONS_URL}/{COLLECTION_ID}/items"
COLLECTION_ITEM_BY_ID_URL = f"{COLLECTIONS_URL}/{COLLECTION_ID}/items/{ITEM_ID}"

## HTTP Success
HTTP_SUCCESS_CODE = 200
We can start off by requesting the HDA landing page, which provides links to the API definition, the available services  (links
) as well as the STAC API index.

application/json.content: {"description":"DestinE Data Lake (DEDL): fulfils the storage and access requirements for any data that is offered to DestinE users. It provides users with seamless access to the datasets, regardless of data type and location.\n\t\tFurthermore, the DEDL supports near-data processing to maximize throughput and service scalability. The data lake is built upon existing data holdings such as ESA, EUMETSAT, ECMWF and Copernicus.\n\t\tEUMETSAT has the end-to-end responsibility for the DEDL.","links":[{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/","rel":"self","type":"application/json"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/","rel":"root","title":"Root endpoint for DEDL API","type":"application/json"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/ui","rel":"child","title":"DEDL Web UI","type":"application/json"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac","rel":"child","title":"DEDL STAC API","type":"application/json"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/docs/openapi.yaml","rel":"service-desc","title":"OpenAPI service description","type":"application/vnd.oai.openapi;version=3.0"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/docs/","rel":"service-doc","title":"OpenAPI service documentation","type":"application/html"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/services","rel":"services","title":"List of available services provided by DEDL","type":"application/json"}],"title":"Destination Earth Data Lake (DEDL) API"}

children.value:
The HDA is plugged to a STAC API.
The STAC API entry point is set to the
endpoint and provides the search capabilities provided by the DEDL STAC interface.

children.value:
It is also possible discover data collections related to a certain topic and provided by a certain provider in a specic time interval.
We specify an open time interval in order to have collections with data starting from a certain datetime.

application/json.content:
{"collections":[{"assets":{"thumbnail":{"href":"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/GOME-2b.jpg","roles":["thumbnail"],"title":"GOME-2 Level 1B - Metop - Global","type":"image/jpeg"}},"description":"The Global Ozone Monitoring Experiment-2 (GOME-2) spectrometer measures profiles and total columns of ozone and of other atmospheric constituents that are related to the depletion of ozone in the stratosphere and its production in the troposphere, as well as to natural and anthropogenic sources of pollution.","extent":{"spatial":{"bbox":[[-180,-90,180,90]]},"temporal":{"interval":[["2007-01-01T00:00:00Z",null]]}},"id":"EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.GOMEL1","keywords":["Level 1 Data","Atmosphere"],"license":"proprietary","links":[{"href":"https://www.eumetsat.int/data-policy/eumetsat-data-policy.pdf","rel":"license","title":"EUMETSAT Data Policy"},{"href":"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:GOMEL1","rel":"describedby","title":"GOME-2 Level 1B - Metop - Global"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/collections/EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.GOMEL1","rel":"self","title":"EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.GOMEL1"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/","rel":"root"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/collections/EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.GOMEL1/items","rel":"items","title":"items"}],"providers":[{"name":"eumetsat","roles":["producer","processor","licensor"],"url":"https://www.eumetsat.int/"},{"name":"eumetsat","roles":["host"],"url":"https://data.eumetsat.int"}],"stac_version":"1.0.0","title":"GOME-2 Level 1B - Metop - Global","type":"Collection"},{"assets":{"thumbnail":{"href":"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/iasi.jpg","roles":["thumbnail"],"title":"IASI Level 1C - All Spectral Samples - Metop - Global","type":"image/jpeg"}},"description":"This product covers all spectral samples. The main objective of the Infrared Atmospheric Sounding Interferometer (IASI) is to provide high resolution atmospheric emission spectra to derive temperature and humidity profiles with high spectral and vertical resolution and accuracy. Additionally it is used for the determination of trace gases such as ozone, nitrous oxide, carbon dioxide and methane, as well as land and sea surface temperature, emissivity and cloud properties. The IASI L1c product contains infra-red radiance spectra at 0.5cm-1 resolution. The EUMETCast product has for each sounder pixel 8461 spectral samples covering the range between 645.0 cm-1 and 2760 cm-1.","extent":{"spatial":{"bbox":[[-180,-90,180,90]]},"temporal":{"interval":[["2009-03-23T00:00:00Z",null]]}},"id":"EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.IASIL1C-ALL","keywords":["Level 1 Data","Atmosphere"],"license":"proprietary","links":[{"href":"https://www.eumetsat.int/data-policy/eumetsat-data-policy.pdf","rel":"license","title":"EUMETSAT Data Policy"},{"href":"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL1C-ALL","rel":"describedby","title":"IASI Level 1C - All Spectral Samples - Metop - Global"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/collections/EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.IASIL1C-ALL","rel":"self","title":"EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.IASIL1C-ALL"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/","rel":"root"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/collections/EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.IASIL1C-ALL/items","rel":"items","title":"items"}],"providers":[{"name":"eumetsat","roles":["producer","processor","licensor"],"url":"https://www.eumetsat.int/"},{"name":"eumetsat","roles":["host"],"url":"https://data.eumetsat.int"}],"stac_version":"1.0.0","title":"IASI Level 1C - All Spectral Samples - Metop - Global","type":"Collection"},{"assets":{"thumbnail":{"href":"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/assets/img/placeholder.png","roles":["thumbnail"],"title":"IASI Combined Sounding Products - Metop","type":"image/png"}},"description":"The main objective of the Infrared Atmospheric Sounding Interferometer (IASI) is to provide high resolution atmospheric emission spectra to derive temperature and humidity profiles with high spectral and vertical resolution and accuracy. Additionally, it is used for the determination of trace gases such as ozone, as well as land and sea surface temperature, emissivity and cloud properties. This combined product (IASI Atmospheric Temperature Water Vapour and Surface Skin Temperature; IASI Cloud Parameters; IASI Ozone and IASI Trace Gases contains temperature Profiles, Humidity Profiles, Surface Temperature, Surface Emissivity, Fractional Cloud Cover, Cloud Top Temperature, Cloud Top Pressure, Cloud Phase, Total Column Ozone, Columnar ozone amounts in thick layers, Total column N2O, CO, CH4, CO2 - all combined in one product.","extent":{"spatial":{"bbox":[[-180,-90,180,90]]},"temporal":{"interval":[["2008-02-13T00:00:00Z",null]]}},"id":"EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.IASSND02","keywords":["Temperature","Humidity","Atmosphere","Level 2 Data"],"license":"proprietary","links":[{"href":"https://www.eumetsat.int/data-policy/eumetsat-data-policy.pdf","rel":"license","title":"EUMETSAT Data Policy"},{"href":"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASSND02","rel":"describedby","title":"IASI Combined Sounding Products - Metop"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/collections/EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.IASSND02","rel":"self","title":"EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.IASSND02"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/","rel":"root"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/collections/EO.EUM.DAT.METOP.IASSND02/items","rel":"items","title":"items"}],"providers":[{"name":"eumetsat","roles":["producer","processor","licensor"],"url":"https://www.eumetsat.int/"},{"name":"eumetsat","roles":["host"],"url":"https://data.eumetsat.int"}],"stac_version":"1.0.0","title":"IASI Combined Sounding Products - Metop","type":"Collection"},{"assets":{"thumbnail":{"href":"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/s3afrpmwirnight.png","roles":["thumbnail"],"title":"SLSTR Level 2 Fire Radiative Power - Sentinel 3","type":"image/png"}},"dedl:short_description":"The Copernicus NRT S3 FRP product identifies the location, and quantifies the radiative power, of any hotspot present on land and ocean Earth surfaces, that radiates a heating signal within a pixel size of 1 km2","description":"The Copernicus NRT S3 FRP product identifies the location, and quantifies the radiative power, of any hotspot present on land and ocean Earth surfaces, that radiates a heating signal within a pixel size of 1 km2
All threatening hotspots are identified and characterised within three hours from SLSTR observation sensing time.
The current version of the NRT S3 FRP processor is mainly applicable during the night while only a few daytime granules, with non-saturated background (i.e. no fires) radiance, are processed at this stage. The NRT S3 FRP product will become operational after a higher level of quality and maturity is reached, including the full processing of granules during daytime, a comprehensive global validation, and positive feedback by experts and users.","extent":{"spatial":{"bbox":[[-180,-90,180,90]]},"temporal":{"interval":[["2020-04-08T00:00:00Z",null]]}},"id":"EO.EUM.DAT.SENTINEL-3.FRP","item_assets":{"thumbnail":{"description":"An averaged, decimated preview image in PNG format. Single polarisation products are represented with a grey scale image. Dual polarisation products are represented by a single composite colour image in RGB with the red channel (R) representing the  co-polarisation VV or HH), the green channel (G) represents the cross-polarisation (VH or HV) and the blue channel (B) represents the ratio of the cross an co-polarisations.","roles":["thumbnail"],"title":"Preview Image","type":"image/png"}},"keywords":["Fire","Level 2 Data","FRP","Fire Radiative Power","Wildfires"],"license":"proprietary","links":[{"href":"https://www.eumetsat.int/data-policy/eumetsat-data-policy.pdf","rel":"license","title":"EUMETSAT Data Policy"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/collections/EO.EUM.DAT.SENTINEL-3.FRP","rel":"self","title":"EO.EUM.DAT.SENTINEL-3.FRP"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/","rel":"root"},{"href":"https://hda.data.destination-earth.eu/stac/collections/EO.EUM.DAT.SENTINEL-3.FRP/items","rel":"items","title":"items"}],"providers":[{"name":"eumetsat","roles":["producer","processor","licensor"],"url":"https://www.eumetsat.int/"},{"name":"eumetsat","roles":["host"],"url":"https://data.eumetsat.int"}],"stac_extensions":["https://stac-extensions.github.io/processing/v1.2.0/schema.json","https://stac-extensions.github.io/item-assets/v1.0.0/schema.json"],"stac_version":"1.0.0","summaries":{"constellation":["Sentinel-3"],"instruments":["SLSTR"],"intruments":["SLSTR"],"platform":["SENTINEL-3A,SENTINEL-3B"],"processing:level":[["L2"]],"s1:product_timeliness":["NRT-3h"]},"title":"SLSTR Level 2 Fire Radiative Power - Sentinel 3","type":"Collection"},{"assets":{"thumbnail":{"href":"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/s3_slstr_1.png","roles":["thumbnail"],"title":"SLSTR Level 1B","type":"image/png"}},"dedl:short_description":"The SLSTR level 1 products contain: the radiances of the 6 visible (VIS), Near Infra-Red (NIR) and Short Wave Infra-Red (SWIR) bands (on the A and B stripe grids); the Brightness Temperature (BT) for the 3 Thermal Infra-Red (TIR) bands; the BT for the 2 Fire (FIR) bands. Resolution: 1km at nadir (TIR), 500m (VIS).","description":"The SLSTR level 1 products contain: the radiances of the 6 visible (VIS), Near Infra-Red (NIR) and Short Wave Infra-Red (SWIR) bands (on the A and B stripe grids); the Brightness Temperature (BT) for the 3 Thermal Infra-Red (TIR) bands; the BT for the 2 Fire (FIR) bands. Resolution: 1km at nadir (TIR), 500m (VIS). All are provided for both the oblique and nadir view. These measurements are accompanied with grid and time information, quality flags, error estimates and meteorological auxiliary data.

- All Sentinel-3 NRT products are available at pick-up point in less than 3h
- All Sentinel-3 Non Time Critical (NTC) products are available at pick-up point in less than 30 days.

children.value:
import json
import os
from getpass import getpass
import destinelab as deauth

DESP_USERNAME = input("Please input your DESP username or email: ")
DESP_PASSWORD = getpass("Please input your DESP password: ")

auth = deauth.AuthHandler(DESP_USERNAME, DESP_PASSWORD)
access_token = auth.get_token()
if access_token is not None:
    print("DEDL/DESP Access Token Obtained Successfully")
else:
    print("Failed to Obtain DEDL/DESP Access Token")

auth_headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}"}

{"assets":{"thumbnail":{"href":"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/s3_slstr_1.png","roles":["thumbnail"],"title":"SLSTR Level 1B","type":"image/png"}},"crs":"http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84","dedl:short_description":"The SLSTR level 1 products contain: the radiances of the 6 visible (VIS), Near Infra-Red (NIR) and Short Wave Infra-Red (SWIR) bands (on the A and B stripe grids); the Brightness Temperature (BT) for the 3 Thermal Infra-Red (TIR) bands; the BT for the 2 Fire (FIR) bands. Resolution: 1km at nadir (TIR), 500m (VIS).","description":"The SLSTR level 1 products contain: the radiances of the 6 visible (VIS), Near Infra-Red (NIR) and Short Wave Infra-Red (SWIR) bands (on the A and B stripe grids); the Brightness Temperature (BT) for the 3 Thermal Infra-Red (TIR) bands; the BT for the 2 Fire (FIR) bands. Resolution: 1km at nadir (TIR), 500m (VIS). All are provided for both the oblique and nadir view. These measurements are accompanied with grid and time information, quality flags, error estimates and meteorological auxiliary data.

- All Sentinel-3 NRT products are available at pick-up point in less than 3h
- All Sentinel-3 Non Time Critical (NTC) products are available at pick-up point in less than 30 days.

children.value: Search for Items in a specific collection

children.label: Search for Items in a specific collection

children.value: It is also possible to get the list of items available in a given
The STAC API also provides an item endpoint (

).
This endpoint allows users to efficiently search for items that match the specified input filters.
endpoint will return the first 20 items found in all the collections available at the

endpoint.
Filters can be added either via query parameters in a
request or added to the JSON body of a
The full detail for each available filter is available in the
The query parameters are added at the end of the URL as a

FILTER = "&datetime=2024-09-18T00:00:00Z/2024-09-20T23:59:59Z&bbox=-10,34,-5,42.5&sortby=datetime&limit=10"
SEARCH_QUERY_STRING = "?collections="+COLLECTION_ID+FILTER
response=requests.get(SEARCH_URL + SEARCH_QUERY_STRING, headers=auth_headers)

JSON(response.json())
The same filters can be added as the JSON body of a
Visualize search results in a table

children.label: Visualize search results in a table

children.value: Visualize search results in a map

children.label: Visualize search results in a map

children.value:
#map1 = folium.Map([38, 0],
#                  zoom_start=4, tiles='Esri Ocean Basemap', attr='Tiles © Esri — Source: Esri, DeLorme, NAVTEQ')

#map1 = folium.Map([38, 0],zoom_start=4)

map1 = folium.Map([38, 0],zoom_start=4, tiles=None)

nasa_wms = folium.WmsTileLayer(
    url='https://gibs.earthdata.nasa.gov/wms/epsg4326/best/wms.cgi',
    name='NASA Blue Marble',
    layers='BlueMarble_ShadedRelief',
    format='image/png',
    transparent=True,
    attr='NASA'
)
nasa_wms.add_to(map1)

results=folium.GeoJson( response.json(),name='Search results',style_function=lambda feature: {
        "fillColor": "#005577",
        "color": "black",
        "weight": 1
    })

results.add_to(map1)


bbox=[-10,34,-5,42.5]
bb=folium.GeoJson(
    shapely.geometry.box(*bbox),name='Search bounding box',style_function=lambda feature: {
        "fillColor": "#ff0000",
        "color": "black",
        "weight": 2,
        "dashArray": "5, 5",
    }
)
bb.add_to(map1)

# Add layer control to toggle visibility
folium.LayerControl().add_to(map1)


#display(fig)
map1
The items belonging to a specific collection can be downloaded entirely, or it is possible to download a single asset of a chosen item.
To get the metadata specific to a given item (identified by its
in a collection, the user can request the
The metadata of a given item contains also the download link that the user can use to download a specific item.

result = json.loads(response.text)
downloadUrl = result['assets']['downloadLink']['href']
print(downloadUrl)

resp_dl = requests.get(downloadUrl,stream=True,headers=auth_headers)

# If the request was successful, download the file
if (resp_dl.status_code == HTTP_SUCCESS_CODE):
        print("Downloading "+ ITEM_ID + "...")
        filename = ITEM_ID + ".zip"
        with open(filename, 'wb') as f:
            for chunk in resp_dl.iter_content(chunk_size=1024): 
                if chunk:
                    f.write(chunk)
                    f.flush()
        print("The dataset has been downloaded to: {}".format(filename))
else: print("Request Unsuccessful! Error-Code: {}".format(response.status_code))
Download a specific asset of an item

children.label: Download a specific asset of an item

children.value:
The metadata of a given item contains also the single assets download link, that the user can use to download a specific asset of the chosen item.
In the example below we download the asset: “xfdumanifest.xml”

downloadUrl = result['assets']['xfdumanifest.xml']['href']
print(downloadUrl)

resp_dl = requests.get(downloadUrl,stream=True,headers=auth_headers)

# If the request was successful, download the file
if (resp_dl.status_code == HTTP_SUCCESS_CODE):
        print("Downloading "+ result['assets']['xfdumanifest.xml']['title'] + "...")
        filename = result['assets']['xfdumanifest.xml']['title']
        with open(filename, 'wb') as f:
            for chunk in resp_dl.iter_content(chunk_size=1024): 
                if chunk:
                    f.write(chunk)
                    f.flush()
        print("The dataset has been downloaded to: {}".format(filename))
else: print("Request Unsuccessful! Error-Code: {}".format(response.status_code))

prev.title: Example of how to use HDA to find and download data for conducting monitoring of Śniadrwy lake
